intro: Actephila pierrei, commonly known as the Hawaiian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and upland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Actephila pierrei is considered a rare and endangered species.
